website_summaries.verdict: The Reebok Trainflex received positive reviews from numerous fitness-oriented users. They considered it a versatile workout shoe. The trainer was also lauded for its reliable support, accurate and comfortable fit and aesthetically pleasing design. However, there were complaints about the narrow toe box and the lack of support. But the majority of buyers still found it a well-performing and affordable choice for regular training.
pros: Numerous fitness buffs appreciated the trainer’s ability to handle a diverse range of workouts and activities
Many consumers praised the shoe’s comfortable and flexible feel
A lot of wearers have complimented the precise fit of the footwear
Priced at $80, it was considered affordable by some purchasers
The shoe offers decent support, based on some user reviews
Several buyers appreciated the sleek design and stylish colorways of the Reebok Trainflex
cons: Wide-footed people have complained of the shoe’s narrow toe box
A few purchasers claimed that the trainer offered little support

customer_reviews.title: Excellent all around gym shoe, slightly narrow
customer_reviews.text: Excellent all around cross-training shoe. Has a little heel drop, but doesn’t feel as pitched forward as a normal runner. Does not have much squish to it, making it better than average for weight lifting. Fits slightly narrow in mid foot/toe box, but not so much that you need to order a size up, unless you are already on the borderline of wide sizes. Length is as expected for a size 11. Tongue is sewn in without padding, which I actually like, it turns out. Easier to lace evenly. Good color (slate blue). Other than these, I also wear the Reebok ROS Workout TR, which is better for weight lifting, but not as good for cardio.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Maxwell

customer_reviews.title: Beginner gym shoes
customer_reviews.text: Color selection is pretty limited but these are budget trainers so it's not a huge deal. They fit well, have good flex up front with a nice and stiff heel. I bought these because I'm getting into working out (mostly strength training) at a gym but didn't want to drop 100$ or more on shoes for something i might not stick with. Overall they work great and have the right attributes for strength training shoes. The trainers at the gym checked them out and i got a confident thumbs up for the shoes. At this price they're a great choice for entry level gym goers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are great! Fit just right and are good for running 3 miles plus CrossFit
customer_reviews.author: Sway124

customer_reviews.title: I do not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I have used these shoes for weight lifting and for running on a track. These shoes are about average for lifting so I'm not gonna complain. However, I have noticed that that with the small amount of running I have done over a week the side wall has started to rip. If these where weight lifting shoes and not "cross trainers" I would not be as suprised but cross training involves more then just lifting. I do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Michael K.

customer_reviews.title: they made the return process SO EASY.
customer_reviews.text: Too small but this is what happens when buying shoes online. However, they made the return process SO EASY.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Yates

customer_reviews.title: Good for narrow foot.
customer_reviews.text: Fit is as expected. I have a narrow foot and this shoe fits very well. Not as comfortable as the addicts galaxy I had previously. Doesn't feel like the heel is secure unless you really tighten them up.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Abbott

customer_reviews.title: I use this shoes every day at the GYM. ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this shoes every day at the GYM. They work as expected. The only thing is if the floor is slippery, this shoes doesn't have much grip.
customer_reviews.author: Edsel Guzman

customer_reviews.title: great fit
customer_reviews.text: great fit, ordered 1/2 size larger ,very light, very comfortable
customer_reviews.author: vincent zambrotta

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoe but I must have ordered the wrong size or they come a little small.
customer_reviews.author: Cwmcs

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable, slightly flatter sole profile helps with balance during squats and deadlifts.
customer_reviews.author: Dmitriy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Came in perfect shape.. quality as expected.. will order again
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: What's with the high heels?
customer_reviews.text: What on earth is going on with men's athletic shoes lately? The "high heels" are ridiculous and fly in the face of ergonomics. Are they trying to appeal to short dudes? Honestly. I don't want to feel like I'm wearing 'platforms' when I'm running or doing squats. Cross-training my eye.
customer_reviews.author: MTL

product_meta.title: Reebok Men's Trainflex Cross-Trainer Shoe
product_meta.description: The Reebok Trainflex takes training to a new level. 3D FuseFrame tech in the heel gives lightweight, seamless support, and SpaceFrame technology provides strength and support. The outsole flexes with your foot's movement.
